hillbillies.model

Class Terrain

  • java.lang.Object
    • hillbillies.model.Terrain

  • public class Terrain
extends java.lang.Object
    Class managing terrain and cubes of a World.
    Invariants:
  • The TerrainChangeListener must be effective.
  • The world must be effective.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      static class  Terrain.Type
      Enum representing cube types.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Terrain

        @Raw
public Terrain(World world,
                    int maxX,
                    int maxY,
                    int maxZ,
                    TerrainChangeListener modelListener)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructs a new terrain.
        Parameters:
        world - The world this terrain belongs to.
        maxX - The size of the world in the X direction.
        maxY - The size of the world in the Y direction.
        maxZ - The size of the world in the Z direction.
        modelListener - The listener for terrain changes.
        Postcondition:
        The getMaxX(), getMaxY() and getMaxZ() functions will return the size of the terrain.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the modelListener isn't effective.
        InvalidCubeTypeException - If any of the supplied terrainTypes are invalid.

    • Method Detail

      • setTerrain

        @Raw
public void setTerrain(int[][][] terrainTypes)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                            InvalidCubeTypeException
        Sets the terrain types.
        Parameters:
        terrainTypes - A list with the types of all cubes.
        Postconditions:
      • A new cube is created for each position in the terrain, the type is set to the supplied type.
      • Any cube that isn't connected to the border will cave in at start.
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - | if the terrainTypes isn't effective or the size doesn't match.
        InvalidCubeTypeException

      • isValidPosition

        public boolean isValidPosition(IntVector pos)
        Checks whether the given position is valid in the world.
        Parameters:
        pos - The position to be checked
        Returns:
        result is true if the position is within world bounds.

 @Immutable
public int getMaxX()
        Returns the number of cubes in the X direction.

public int getMaxY()
        Returns the number of cubes in the Y direction.

        @Basic
 @Immutable
public int getMaxZ()
        Returns the number of cubes in the Z direction.

      • isSolid

        public static boolean isSolid(Terrain.Type type)
        Checks whether the given cube type is solid.
        Parameters:
        type - The type to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the type is solid.

      • isCubeConnected

        public boolean isCubeConnected(IntVector pos)
                        throws InvalidPositionException
        Checks whether the cube at the given position has a path to the border.
        Parameters:
        pos - The position of the cube to be checked.
        Returns:
        True if the cube is connected to the border.
        Throws:
        InvalidPositionException - Throws if the given position is invalid.

      • getCubeType

        public Terrain.Type getCubeType(IntVector cube)
                         throws InvalidPositionException
        Gets the type of the cube at the given position.
        Parameters:
        cube - The location of the cube.
        Returns:
        An integer representing the type of the cube.
        Throws:
        InvalidPositionException - If the given position is invalid.

      • setCubeType

        public void setCubeType(IntVector pos,
                        Terrain.Type type)
                 throws InvalidPositionException
        Sets the type of the cube at the given position.
        Parameters:
        pos - The position of the cube
        type - The new type
        Postcondition:
        The cube at position pos will have the given type and any cubes that aren't connected to the border anymore will cave in. When cubes cave in they may drop a boulder or a log.
        Effect:
        If the type is a workshop, the workshop is added to the world.
        Throws:
        InvalidPositionException - If the given position is invalid.

      • breakCube

        public void breakCube(IntVector location)
               throws InvalidPositionException
        Break a cube at the given position.
        Parameters:
        location - The location of the cube.
        Effects:
      • Sets the CubeType to air.
            this.setCubeType(location, Type.Air)
      • There is a chance to drop an boulder or log.
            this.getWorld().dropChance(location, this.getCubeType(location))
        • Throws:
        InvalidPositionException

      • removeObjectFromCube

        public void removeObjectFromCube(GameObject object)
        Removes the given object from its cube.
        Parameters:
        object - The object to be removed.
        Postcondition:
        The cube where the object was positioned won't contain the object anymore.

      • addObjectToCube

        public void addObjectToCube(GameObject object)
        Adds a gameObject to its cube.
        Parameters:
        object - The gameObject to add to its cube.
        Postcondition:
        The cube given by the gameObjects position will now contain the gameObject.

      • getLogs

        public java.util.Set<Log> getLogs(IntVector cubeLoc)
                           throws InvalidPositionException
        Returns all the logs at the given location.
        Parameters:
        cubeLoc - The location of the cube.
        Throws:
        InvalidPositionException - If the given position is not valid.

      • getBoulders

        public java.util.Set<Boulder> getBoulders(IntVector cubeLoc)
                                   throws InvalidPositionException
        Returns all the boulders at the given location.
        Parameters:
        cubeLoc - The location of the cube.
        Throws:
        InvalidPositionException - If the given position is not valid.

      • getNeighbours

        public static java.util.stream.Stream<IntVector> getNeighbours(IntVector pos)
        Returns a stream of all neighbours of the given position.
        Parameters:
        pos - The position to get all neighbours from.
        Returns:
        A stream obtained by adding each offset [-1, 0, 1] to the position.

      • getDirectlyAdjacent

        public static java.util.stream.Stream<IntVector> getDirectlyAdjacent(IntVector pos)
        Returns a stream of all neighbours of the given position.
        Parameters:
        pos - The position to get all neighbours from.
        Returns:
        A stream gotten by adding each offset [-1, 0, 1] to the position without any diagonal positions.
